The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces a compact, low-growing rosette of fleshy leaves that help store water, and its flowers bloom in shades of pink or white. Carlowrightia neesiana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
